title: Laura Whitmore opens up about suffering from tragic miscarriage alone
text:

Laura Whitmore spoke about the heartbreaking moment she suffered a miscarriage last year.

The former MTV presenter - who has been in a relationship with Love Island comic Iain Stirling for more than two years, unveiled that doctors couldn't detect a heartbeat when she went for a 12 week scan.

The Irish star hadn't initially planned for her pregnancy, and admitted that she didn't know whether to "cry or be emotional" following the heartbreaking news.

In a piece she wrote for Hot Press, Laura said that she noticed her boobs were "massive" while on a job in Italy.

And after coming to the shock realisation that she was expecting, Laura admitted that she "didn't want her life to change", and told herself she could still be "pregnant and have fun".

The 32-year-old detailed her visit to the midwife, and spent two hours going through all of her birth options before booking a private scan at Harley Street that evening.

(Image: Hewitt / SplashNews.com)

She confessed: "In the room I could see the outline of what looked like a jelly baby - just like in the movies," before adding there was silence and the doctor responded: "I'm sorry there's no heart-beat."

(Image: Instagram)

The blonde beauty claimed she was left "spinning" and said: "I wasn't sure how I was supposed to react. Should I cry? Was I allowed to be emotional for something unplanned?"

Laura also went on to reveal that she felt "alone" while trying to come to terms with what she had been through, and the miscarriage made her realise that she does want to have children.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

She's been in a long-term relationship with Iain since 2017, and in March last year the Love Island legend "happily" admitted that he was punching above his weight by dating Laura.
description: The presenter, 32, wrote about her struggle to come to terms of realisation when she miscarried with unplanned baby
